where P is the pressure (GPa), $V_0$ is the volume at ambient pressure, $V$ is the deformed volume, $B_0$ is the bulk modulus (GPa), and $B_0^\prime$ is the pressure derivative of the bulk modulus.
All 3 parameters, $V_0$, $B_0$, and $B_0^\prime$ have been fitted simultaneously using software EoSFit7 ~\cite{Angel14}.
The cell volumes determined at ambient pressure have been included in the fit since the data were measured by the same experimental method as the data obtained at the high pressures and therefore are the subject of the same experimental errors.\\
It is difficult to reveal a phase transition from pressure-volume (P-V) plot, especially when pressure induced volume change is small. Thus, we used so-called $F-f$ plot\cite{Anderson95} to verify a suspicion for possible phase transitions. This plot shows a dependency of the normalized stress $F$:
